doc:
Reginald Beckwith https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_Beckwith 0 William Reginald Beckwith (2 November 1908 – 26 June 1965) was an English film and television actor, who made almost one hundred film and television appearances in his career.Beckwith was also a film critic and playwright before the war, and from 1941-45, was a BBC war correspondent. His play Boys in Brown was filmed in 1949, and he co-wrote the film You're Only Young Twice in 1952, based on James Bridie's play. William_Reginald_Beckwith ( 2_November_1908 – 26_June_1965 ) was an_English_film_and_television_actor , who made almost_one_hundred_film_and_television_appearances in his_career.Beckwith was also a_film_critic_and_playwright before the_war , and from 1941-45 , was a_BBC_war_correspondent . His_play_Boys in Brown was_filmed in 1949 , and he co-wrote the_film You 're Only_Young Twice in 1952 , based on James_Bridie 's_play .
